item.title: Nintendo Switch Online Adds Three Genesis Games, Including Some Leaving Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-switch-online-adds-three-genesis-games-including-some-leaving-steam/1100-6528102/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Not every title from the 16-bit era of consoles is readily available to legally play, but three more games from the Sega Genesis vault are heading to Nintendo Switch. ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron, Vectorman, and Mercs will all be available starting today. Nintendo made the announcement on X and dropped a brief trailer for all three games.

Three classic SEGA Genesis games have just been made available for #NintendoSwitchOnline + Expansion Pack members!

☑️ ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron
☑️ Vectorman
☑️ WOLF OF THE BATTLEFIELD: MERCS
Original packaging shown. Contest has ended. pic.twitter.com/83mMTzfl4m

— Nintendo of America (@NintendoAmerica) November 27, 2024

ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron is the first sequel in the franchise, and it debuted on Genesis in 1993. While the aliens known as ToeJam and Earl were stranded on Earth in the first game, Panic on Funkotron brings the duo back to their home planet where new problems await them. Several humans stowed away on their journey to Funkotron, and it's up to ToeJam and Earl to make things right in this side-scrolling platformer.

Vectorman was a state-of-the-art game by 1995 standards, and also Genesis' answer to Super Nintendo's Donkey Kong Country. Developer BlueSky Software successfully utilized pre-rendered 3D models that made this 2D action-platformer stand out from other Genesis titles. The initial story for the game is similar to Pixar's WALL-E, because the Earth has been abandoned by humans who left robots behind to clean up their mess. The story diverges when one of the robots becomes a nuclear-powered tyrant known as WarHead, leaving Vectorman as the only robot on Earth who isn't under his control.

Mercs--or Wolf of the Battlefield: Mercs--was an arcade title developed and released by Capcom before Sega brought it to the Genesis in 1990. Up to three players could assume control of the covert mercenaries in Wolf Force. Their mission was to infiltrate Zutula--a fictional African country--and rescue the former President from rebels who seized control of the land.

ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron and Vectorman are among the long list of games that Sega is delisting from Steam in December. Meanwhile, Sega launched a new line of Genesis game-themed merchandise at Amazon. The company is also planning to reboot five of its classic franchises: Jet Set Radio, Shinobi, Golden Axe, Streets of Rage, and Crazy Taxi.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart Is Only $30 Right Now On PS5 For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ratchet-clank-rift-apart-is-only-30-right-now-on-ps5-for-black-friday/1100-6528105/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Black Friday shopping season is here, and plenty of PlayStation games are on sale. If your'e looking for a copy of Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, you're in luck, as Target and Best Buy have the game on PS5 for only $30 right now for the popular shopping season. It normally sells for $70.

Rift Apart was released in 2021 from developer Insomniac Games, and scored solid reviews across the board, including a 9/10 from GameSpot. We praised the game's gorgeous presentation and DualSense controller features, and also lauded the addition of the instantly lovable character, Rivet.

Developer Insomniac would go on to release Marvel's Spider-Man 2 in 2023 and is now working on Marve's Wolverine, which will be exclusive to PlayStation. The developer has not announced any new entries in the series, with Rift Apart being the most recent.

There are loads of other PlayStation games on sale this Black Friday, including Astro Bot, Death Stranding's Director's Cut, and Stellar Blade, among others. If you're in the market for a new PS5 console, you can get the PS5 Slim Fortnite Cobalt bundle for under $400.

Keep checking back with GameSpot for more Black Friday deals in the days ahead.

item.title: Get Helldivers 2 For Only $30 For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-helldivers-2-for-only-30-for-black-friday/1100-6528101/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Helldivers 2 is one of 2024's best-selling games, and it's on sale right now for Black Friday. The retailers Best Buy and Walmart are selling the third-person shooter on PS5 for just $30. The game is also marked down nicely for its PC version.

Helldivers 2 was one of the first big success stories in gaming for 2024. It launched in early February and quickly became a sales juggernaut, becoming the fastest-selling PlayStation game ever. The game has continued to put up strong sales numbers and ranks No. 2 overall for 2024's best-selling games in the US through October, trailing only EA Sports College Football 25.

A fantastic co-op game, Helldivers 2 was developed by Arrowhead Studios and is also available on PC. You can grab the game's PC edition from GameSpot sister site Fanatical for only $28

Helldivers 2 isn't for everyone, and if you're interested in something else, there are plenty of other fantastic deals on PlayStation games available now. Titles like Demon's Souls, Returnal, The Last of Us Parts 1 and 2, and Uncharted: Legacy of Thieves Collection all have great discounts.

If you need a PS5 console, those are on sale, too, and you can see the best deals available through the links below.

item.title: Nintendo Switch Pro-Style Controller With Built-In Menu Screen Gets Nice Discount
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-switch-pro-style-controller-with-built-in-menu-screen-gets-nice-discount/1100-6528094/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The unique ManbaOne Wireless Controller just hit its lowest price ever for Black Friday, and this third-party gamepad is a surprisingly cool alternative to your standard Switch Pro Controller. Along with all the usual bells and whistles of a premium gamepad, the ManbaOne features a built-in screen so you can quickly toggle your settings.

ManbaOne Wireless Controller

$56 (was $70)

  • Works with Switch, PC, iOS, Android
  • Four remappable back buttons
  • Available in white and black
  • Hall Effect analog sticks
  • Customizable lights
  • Six-axis gyroscope
  • Built-in display
  • Trigger locks

The ManbaOne Wireless Controller packs in tons of features and is highly customizable. Its main attraction is a built-in two-inch display, which lets you quickly change settings without the need for an app or additional software. Beyond that standout feature, this is a feature-rich pro-style controller.

That means you’ll find four remappable back buttons, premium Hall Effect analog sticks to prevent drift, trigger locks for faster actuation, and a fully customizable RGB lightbar on its side. Toss in a turbo setting and six-axis gyro support, and you’ve got a controller that’s incredibly well-equipped for less than $60. As a bonus, the ManbaOne comes with its own charging dock and a set of interchangeable thumbsticks.

Both the white and black versions are discounted, and they’re both pretty stylish. The white model is a bit more mechanical, as it shows off various components underneath the faceplate, while the black model is closer to what you’d expect a traditional controller to look like.

Though the ManbaOne is down to an excellent price for Black Friday, it’s not the only controller on sale right now. The 8BitDo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller for Switch & PC is also cheap, listed for $48 (was $70). There’s also a unique GameCube-inspired Joy-Con alternative available for $49 (was $70), so you have plenty of great third-party options to choose from right now. And if you’d prefer to stick with first-party Nintendo gamepads, there are a handful of discounts on Joy-Con and Switch Pro Controllers.

Most of these savings are bound to end after Black Friday, so check out the impressive offers while you can.

  • Get Dark Souls Board Game For Only $51 And Roleplaying Sourcebook For $30
  • PS5 Pro Disc Drive Is Sold Out At Most Retailers, But Walmart Has It (For Now)
  • The PS5 Pro Is Available Now And Eligible For One-Day Delivery At Amazon
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Zelda: Echoes Of Wisdom Is Already On Sale For 25% Off
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard Collector's Edition In Stock On Launch Day For PS5 And Xbox

  • Target's Exclusive Shadow The Hedgehog Lego Set Is Discounted Just Weeks After Its Release
  • King Boo's Haunted Mansion Lego Mario Set Gets First Price Cut At Amazon
Jon Bitner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: PlayStation Plus Free Games For December 2024 Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-plus-essential-free-games-for-december-2024/1100-6528063/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation has revealed this month's batch of free games for PlayStation Plus subscribers. All PS Plus members will be able to claim a trio of freebies starting December 3--Aliens: Dark Descent, It Takes Two, and Temtem. If you haven't claimed November's PlayStation Plus free games yet, make sure to do so before Tuesday, when the new games go live.

One of the very best co-op games ever made, It Takes Two combines platforming with imaginative teamwork. As Cody and May, a couple with a rocky relationship who have been trapped in a fantasy world, players will have to work together to overcome unique challenges and possibly mend a broken partnership. The game has been a critical and commercial success story since it was first released a couple of years ago, and its director Josef Fares has recently been teasing that studio Hazelight is working on something new that'll be published by EA again.

On the opposite end of wholesome co-op platforming, Aliens: Dark Descent is a real-time strategy game where you'll guide a squad of Colonial Space Marines through a deadly Xenomorph outbreak. With all communication lost on the moon of Lethe, it's up to you to figure out what happened and survive the journey. You can customize the abilities, weapons, and talents of your Marines, and while the core gameplay can become repetitive, it's still an authentic dive into the galaxy of Aliens.

Finally, Temtem is a neat spin on the catch-'em-all formula established by Pokemon. You'll get to explore the six islands of the Airborne Archipelago, encounter dozens of Temtem, and train them in your quest to become the very best, like no one ever was. The game also features MMO elements, and you can team up with other players if you're looking to trade Temtem or battle them in intense competitions.

PlayStation Plus Free Games for December 2024

Available December 3 until January 6, 2025.

  • Aliens: Dark Descent (PS5, PS4)
  • Temtem (PS5)
  • It Takes Two (PS5, PS4)

As part of PlayStation's 30th Anniversary celebrations, Sony has also announced several events that'll be taking place in December. Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 will be available as a game trial for PS Plus Premium members starting December 3, and the PlayStation Classics Catalogue will expand with the arrival of Sly 2: Band of Thieves, Sly 3: Honor Among Thieves, and Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy later this month.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: DayZ Developer Responds To Frostline DLC Review-Bombing On Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dayz-developer-responds-to-frostline-dlc-review-bombing-on-steam/1100-6528098/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fans of the zombie survival-horror game DayZ have taken a chunk out of its Steam user-score after developer Bohemia Interactive released a DLC that players say is overpriced and underwhelming. Now, the game's developer has responded to the criticism… by posting a Beatles song.

"Did you know that 8 million users for whom we have data on Steam played for an average of 188 hours and paid an average of 30 USD gross in Dayz?" Bohemia Interactive CEO Marek Spanel said on Twitter. "That means we received less than 10 cents for an hour of live online gaming, for which we host the online infrastructure and have been updating it for 10+ years. Yet DayZ Frostline is currently being review-bombed on the same platform for being too expensive: $26.99 for 'just a map,' and some users demand 'gimme more for less money.' Hmm. Please Please Me."

Did you know that 8 million users for whom we have data on Steam played for an average of 188 hours and paid an average of 30 USD gross in #Dayz? That means we received less than 10 cents for an hour of live online gaming, for which we host the online infrastructure and have been… pic.twitter.com/zOMQNvEPtq

— Marek Spanel (@maruksp) November 26, 2024

The post was accompanied by a clip from the Beatles song Please Please Me.

Released in October, the Frostline DLC retails for $27, a price that players say is far too high given what's included. The game is currently sitting at a "Mostly Negative" user review score on Steam, where players are pointing out the DLC's various flaws. The main problem seems to be a lack of new, engaging content.

"First things first: This is not even an original map," one user pointed out. "This $37 CAD DLC map is a cut-down reskin of the ArmA III map 'Tanoa.' That being said, Sakhal does have some neat stuff to it, but it is absolutely not worth its asking price as of right now. Maybe in time they'll add more interesting features to the map to justify its existence, but right now you can get much better maps for free, and Bohemia knows it."

"This is an extremely lazy effort from Bohemia Interactive," the player continued. "Bugs that have plagued this game for years go unmentioned, the fabled 'AI overhaul' has been pushed back for years, but now we have a snowy Tanoa with less landmass to explore, and most of the islands they left intact are just completely empty anyways. Joy."

Others have pointed out that the DLC's more interesting POIs--like the new map's Weather Dome and Volcano--cannot be entered or interacted with whatsoever. Others have pointed out that maps with far more content have been released for free by modders.

Aside from Spanel's Beatles-based reaction, Bohemia Interactive has yet to make any further comment on the controversy.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Gran Turismo 7 Is Available For A Fantastic Price Right Now During Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gran-turismo-7-is-available-for-a-fantastic-price-right-now-during-black-friday/1100-6528097/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Black Friday is in full swing, and if you're looking for a copy of Gran Turismo 7, you're in luck. Walmart is selling the racing game on PS5 for $30 right now, which is among the best deals we've ever seen. If you'd prefer the PS4 edition, that's on sale at Walmart for only $20, which is a phenomenal price.

If you'd prefer to shop at a different store, Best Buy has Gran Turismo 7 on sale for only $30 right now as well. It's always nice to have options.

Gran Turismo 7 originally launched in March 2022 from developer Polyphony Digital. The game received a generally positive critical response, including an 8/10 from GameSpot. In particular, we praised the game's stunning visuals and variety of single-player activities to take part in. The game also has more customization options than past games, excellent handling, and speedy load times.

There are plenty of other PlayStation games on sale for Black Friday, including a fantastic discount on God of War Ragnarok. Check out the lists below to see all the best deals on PlayStation games, consoles, and accessories. Keep checking back with GameSpot for more Black Friday deals coming up.
